title: Hematology
description: Development and function of blood as a tissue. Composition, function, and mechanisms of formation and destruction of blood components in health and disease. Methods for examination of blood. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: BIO 351 or BIO 302 or BIO 303 or CHEM 373, or graduate standing in Biological Sciences
recommended: BIO 361 or ZOO 332 or BMED 460; CHEM 313 or CHEM 371
